Recommended By Curators

About This Game

For the First Time
Outdoor Campaigns
Full Soundtrack and Effects
True Point & Click Mouse Interface
Auto-Mapping
Unprecedented Depth of Story

Begin your adventure in Crusaders of the Dark Savant. Import your characters from Bane of the Cosmic Forge or create a new party capable of surviving the rigors of a strange alien world.

Both friends and foes you'll discover as you search for the forgotton secret of a once madman - the secret of the very universe itself. And you won't be alone in your search. Others as enterprising as you have also entered this dimension. Only your actions - both past and present - will determine just how well you fare. From the depths of a dungeon to the blue and limitless skies, you'll see it all - you'll hear it all - in this latest Wizardry adventure.

Never
Never has a game been as true to authentic fantasy role playing. Never has a game had four different beginnings. Never has a game been so vast.

Sometimes
Sometimes you won't find everything as you left it; you're not alone in this world. Sometimes the people you meet will like you... if you've been nice to their friends.

Forever
Forever true to the most acclaimed fantasy role-playing simulation ever, the sequel to Bane of the Cosmic Forge. Forever beautiful graphics and sound - indoors and out. Forever in the tradition of... Wizardry

Wizardry 7 Gold is currently only available in English and on the Windows platform.
READ MORE

daveog999

3 reviews
Recommended
8.2 hrs on record
Posted: September 15
I played this game about 20 years ago and enjoyed it so much. It was a challenge back then and is a challenge now, but it's still a lot of fun. It's a true old-school RPG and one of the best I've ever played. So much depth to it but it really does require persistence. You will feel lost and not sure what you're supposed to be doing at times, but it's worth it if you can stick at it.

h0li-Ghett0
274 products in account
40 reviews
Recommended
0.6 hrs on record
Posted: December 29, 2013
Oh wow, a blast from the past that requires some love.

20 years ago, I thought I was good at RPGs. Then I played Crusaders of the Dark Savant and realized I was good at following the bread crumbs that easy to moderate RPGs lay out for us.

This game was incredibly difficult in the era when there was no gamefaqs.com to download walkthroughs on. When FAQs became a common theme, I re-installed and found it was still pretty tough. That being said, it has a unique world setting, a greatly diverse character class and race structure, and an extensive story-line that is unique and engaging.

Wizardry is not a world for the feint of heart, but for those who embrace a challenge, love RPGs and have an affection for Old School gaming, Crusaders of the Dark Savant is a challenge you must embrace. A stellar game that received far too little fanfare in it's day and is deserving of re-incarnation.
Read More
 
Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
29 of 36 people (81%) found this review helpful
슙Crunk슙
213 products in account
28 reviews
Recommended
6.8 hrs on record
Posted: March 19, 2014
In all fairness, you'd be better off buying the GoG.com version of this one. You get more stuff with GoG.

Play the DOSBOX version if you can because Gold is very crippled by age and does not perform right on Modern machines. For example, the game screen is stuck at a 640x400 size... you can't change it sadly, unless you put the games shortcut in Compatibility mode, and force windows to temporarily resize your desktop resolution down to 640x480. Not a pleasant solution in my opinion.

Other than those gripes, if you're not familar with old school CRPG games, you're going to ♥♥♥♥ing hate this game, because it is hard. Long. And unforgiving to noobs. It ain't Final Fantasy. And it ain't Skyrim, scrub.

Here's what not to look forward to:
No automapping- Nope not in this game kid. Back in my day we had to do this ♥♥♥♥ with grid paper and draw the maps ourselves. Good luck figuring out where the hell you are in the game. *Psst Gamefaqs got yo back G*

♥♥♥♥ Stat Rolling system for created Characters- Believe me, you will be doing this alot the first few times or so because the way the game is set up. You get 1 shot for stats per character creation. At the end of character creation, you either accept what you've rolled, or delete it... thus bringing you back to the character review screen where you'll have to go through the entire character creation process. It's an exhausting process,

Thousands of ♥♥♥♥ing words! - Hope you enjoy reading sport! Because that's what you'll be doing in this game. No voice acting here. The Gold edition does provide voice narration, but I honestly couldn't deal listening to the guy talk.

The plus to this game is the challenge it presents you. It's a very long dive.. if you do it right it could last you a month or so of game time.

The story is awesome! A mix of sci-fi and low fantasy. It's one of the few CRPGs that tied your party to the previous games. So if you beat Wizardry 6, and imported them into 7, whatever ending you got in 6 carries over into 7. It's pretty cool!

I give this game 7/10 Donut Farts

Recommended
797.9 hrs on record
Posted: May 12, 2014
Old school turn-based RPG action with an engaging story, interesting NPCs, a surprising degree of non-linearity. Add in deep character customization and actions that actually have long-term (and sometimes surprising, unintended consequences) and you've got a gem with some true replay value.

Truly a gem of old school rpg, runs smoothly, i have found no glitches or lag. The variety of classes and ability to change classes makes it great to create characters to suit yourself and your style. Its well worth the small price for the game. The world is huge and it has great replayablility. i GIVE IT A 10 OUT OF 10!
